title: Man charged in shooting of boy, 3, in Clinton Twp.
content:
Clinton Township — A man who allegedly shot a 3-year-old boy in the head this week while at a park was arraigned on Wednesday.
Christian Eric-Deandre Howard was charged by the Macomb County Prosecutor's Office with child abuse second degree; firearms receiving and concealing; felony firearm and careless discharge causing injury or death, according to Clinton Township police.
Howard was arraigned in 41B District Court and his bond was set at $50,000.
The boy is in stable condition after being shot in the head at about 8:45 p.m. Monday while at Normandy Park, located on Little Mack about halfway between 14 Mile and 15 Mile.
Police have issued a no contact order for the defendant.
The boy was initially taken to McLaren Hospital Macomb and then later transferred to Children's Hospital in Detroit.
